metadata.case_name: Shri Ram Bachan Lal v. Dehri-Dalmianagar Notified Area Committee

facts.text: Dehri-Dalmianagar Notified Area Committee constituted by notification dated May 23, 1942, under sub-s.1 of s.388 of Bihar and Orissa Municipal Act, 1922.
By notification dated May 23, 1941, Governor of Bihar applied various provisions of the Act to the notified area under s.389.
Bihar Municipal Amendment Act, 1953 (Bihar Act XXXII of 1953) inserted cl.ff in sub-s.1 of s.82 for tax on trades, professions, callings and employments, and inserted Chapter IV-A (ss.150A to 150E).
Proviso iv added to sub-s.1 of s.82 by Bihar Act III of 1959.
On March 1, 1957, Governor of Bihar applied cl.ff of sub-s.1 of s.82 and ss.150A to 150E to Dehri-Dalmianagar Notified Area.
On March 4, 1957, Governor of Bihar sanctioned imposition of profession tax by Dehri-Dalmianagar Notified Area Committee at maximum rates in Fourth Schedule.
On March 23, 1959, Governor of Bihar directed levy of tax under cl.ff at maximum rates from April 1, 1959, including for Dehri-Dalmianagar Notified Area Committee.

Dehri-Dalmianagar Notified Area Committee issued demand notices to petitioner Shri Ram Bachan Lal, Land Officer of Rohtas Industries Ltd., Dalmianagar, for profession tax for 1963-64, 1964-65, 1965-66, and consolidated notice.
Petition under Art.32 filed to quash demand notices on ground that provisions infringe Arts.14, 19 and 31.
Petitioner was not aware that provisions had been applied to the notified area.

legal_issues.text: Whether ss.388 and 389 of the Act violate Art.14 of the Constitution.
Whether s.82(1)ff, ss.150A to 150E, and the Fourth Schedule offend Arts.14, 19(1)(g) and 31 of the Constitution.

petitioner_arguments.text: Ss.388 and 389 give arbitrary power to Government to constitute notified area committee instead of municipality under s.4, violating Art.14.
Proviso to s.82(1)ff enables Government to exempt classes of professions without guidance, violating Art.14.
Rate of tax left to discretion of Commissioners under s.82(1)ff and Government under proviso iv without guidance.
Proviso iv to s.82(1) void as no indication of circumstances for Government to direct levy of tax.
Act does not lay down proper procedure for assessment and determination of tax.
No appeals or references provided; only review under s.150E.

court_reasoning.text: Ss.388 and 389 provide sufficient guidance as s.388 applies where s.4 requirements not satisfied but administrative provisions needed; no arbitrary power.
court_reasoning.key_observation: S.4 contemplates towns with min. population, density, non-agricultural pursuits; s.388 for other areas.

court_reasoning.text: Proviso to s.82(1)ff re exemptions academic as not exercised and severable.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Would not give relief to petitioner even if invalid.

court_reasoning.text: Guidance for tax rates from max. in Fourth Schedule and purposes in s.150D.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Liberty Cinema holds needs of taxing body provide guidance.

court_reasoning.text: Proviso iv used if Commissioners fail duty; control under Chapter XIII.
Assessment follows Income-tax Act, 1922 procedure per Expl.1 to s.150A; Expl.2 merely requires production of order.
S.150E provides reasonable review remedy following ss.115,117-119 procedure.

holdings.text: Ss.388 and 389 do not violate Art.14.
S.82(1)ff, ss.150A-150E and Fourth Schedule do not offend Arts.14, 19(1)(g) or 31.

precedents_cited.case_name: Corporation of Calcutta v. Liberty Cinema
precedents_cited.relevance: Needs of taxing body for statutory functions provide sufficient guidance for fixing tax rates.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Provisions challenged as infringing fundamental rights.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar and Orissa Municipal Act, 1922
statutes_cited.relevance: Applied to notified area; basis for profession tax levy.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Income-tax Act, 1922
statutes_cited.relevance: Procedure for computing taxable income under Expl.1 to s.150A.

Bihar Act III of 1959
statutes_cited.relevance: Empowered Government to direct levy of tax.

outcome.summary: The Court upheld the validity of ss.388, 389, s.82(1)ff, ss.150A-150E and Fourth Schedule, finding no violation of Arts.14, 19(1)(g) or 31. Petition under Art.32 dismissed.

key_quotes.text: "for a statutory provision for raising revenue for the purposes of the delegate... the needs of the taxing body for carrying out its functions under the statute... may afford sufficient guidance to make the power to fix the rate of tax valid."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: From Liberty Cinema; justifies guidance for tax rates via s.150D.

key_quotes.text: Section 388 would come into the picture only if the requirements of s.4 are not satisfied but yet the Government considers it necessary to make administrative provisions.
key_quotes.speaker: court
